subject: Leadership
title: Ethics in the Digital Age
description: A fast breakdown of Ethics in the Digital Age for builders.

hook.text: Algorithms make decisions about hiring, lending, and policing. But algorithms inherit the biases of their creators.

buildup.text: AI ethics: data privacy, algorithmic bias, surveillance, and the displacement of human judgment in key decisions.

discovery.text: O'Neil's 'Weapons of Math Destruction': opaque algorithms scale bias invisibly and without accountability.

twist.text: Leaders can't delegate ethics to engineers. Technology decisions are leadership decisions with moral consequences.

climax.text: Audit algorithms for bias. Require transparency in automated decisions. Keep human oversight in high-stakes processes.

punchline.text: Technology is never neutral. It amplifies the values of whoever built it.

quiz.question: Why can't leaders delegate AI ethics to engineers alone?
options: Technology decisions have moral consequences requiring leadership oversight
